comments.body: The tests could also check that the arrays share memory, but not a big deal, it is obviously enough they should.

Error message comparison:

```
ValueError: invalid axis for this array in `destination` argument
AxisError: destination: axis 5 is out of bounds for array of dimension 3
```

                            np.moveaxis, x, 0, 5)
        assert_raises_regex(ValueError, 'repeated axis in `source`',

comments.body:
Another useful test might be
```python
class BoolErrors:
    def __bool__(self):
        raise ValueError("Not allowed")

np.array([BoolErrors(), BoolErrors()]).nonzero()
```
which is similar to the test that came up for sorting objects with erroring comparators (https://github.com/numpy/numpy/pull/9412/files#diff-bc1e8d40b8b7758facc5e143be016f99R1485)
